goals__remit: The European Sustainable Development (ESDN) is an informal network of public administrators and other experts dealing with sustainable development (SD) strategies in Europe. The ESDN is governed by a Steering Group of 8 European countries (Austria, Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Luxembourg, and Switzerland) and co-chaired by Austria. The European Commission has an Observer Role in the ESND Steering Group. The ESDN is active in promoting sustainable development and facilitating the exchange of good practices in Europe, and gives advice to policy-makers at the EU and national level. The network has four strategic targets: (1) Advancing sustainable development at the EU and Member States level; (2) Facilitating the exchange of good practices and experiences on sustainable development across Europe; (3) Providing added-value for policy-makers of the EU, its Member States and other European countries; and (4) Mainstreaming sustainable development issues into vertical and horizontal integration of the EU, national and sub-national levels of policy-making, especially integration of the EU SDS in the executive and steering-cycle of the EU. In light of the efforts necessary to implement the 2030 Agenda for SD, the ESDN established a Peer Learning mechanism to facilitate the exchange of experiences and good practices between national policy-makers. The ESDN will strive to foster European policy-making on sustainable development, through targeted ESDN workshops with national policy-makers on 2030 Agenda for SD implementation, and annual ESDN conferences with a broader stakeholder audience, including a strong collaboration with EU institutions (Council, Commission, and Parliament).
relevant_communication:
The ESDN website (www.sd-network.eu) is the largest one-stop-shop on SD policies and strategies in Europe, covering all 28 EU Member States, plus various other European countries. It also includes the country profiles which provide for each country an overview of their SD policies, strategies, vertical and horizontal policy mechanisms, etc.  
The ESDN sends out regular Newsletters (4 times per year) about its activities, EU and Member States SD policies, news on SD policies and strategies in general, on international SD issues (e.g. UN, OECD), and on stakeholder activities, to about 2,000 subscribers. 
The ESDN writes Quarterly Reports (4 reports per year) about topic SD policy issues. 
The ESDN steers and supports the European Sustainable Development Week (ESDW) that is a European-wide initiative to stimulate and make visible activities, projects and events that promote sustainable development and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
